rules: Rule1: If the device gives an initial positive reading, then provided that the player's violation is confirmed, the game competition is fair.
Rule2: Either the device gives an initial positive reading or the device gives a secondary positive reading.
Rule3: If the device's test is valid, then given that the device gives a secondary positive reading, whenever the player's violation is confirmed, the game competition is fair.
Rule4: Provided that the device is calibrated, the device's test is valid.
Rule5: Either the device is calibrated or the device is approved.
Rule6: Whenever the device is approved, the device's test is valid.
Rule7: If a penalty is applied to the player, then the game competition is fair.
Rule8: Under the condition that an automatic suspension occurs, a penalty is applied to the player.
Rule9: An automatic suspension occurs or a manual review occurs.
Rule10: Under the condition that an investigation is opened, a penalty is applied to the player.
Rule11: If the review is complete, then provided that a manual review occurs, an investigation is opened.
Rule12: The game competition is active or it is not the case that the player is disqualified.
Rule13: Whenever a quick assessment occurs, the review is complete.
Rule14: A quick assessment occurs or a detailed analysis occurs.
Rule15: Provided that a detailed analysis occurs, the review is complete.
Rule16: The game experiences a technical glitch or the game competition is fair.
Rule17: Under the condition that the device experiences a sensor malfunction, equipment failure occurs.
Rule18: If the device experiences a software bug, then human error occurs or if the game experiences a technical glitch, then the device produces a false positive.
Rule19: Provided that the device experiences a hardware issue, the device experiences a sensor malfunction or the device experiences a software bug.
Rule20: If the device experiences a firmware problem, then the device experiences a sensor malfunction or the device experiences a software bug.
Rule21: Under the condition that the substance contains alcohol, it is not the case that the game competition is active.
Rule22: Provided that standard procedure is followed, if a test is required, then the substance contains alcohol or the device detects alcohol.
Rule23: Under the condition that an emergency test occurs, if a test is required, then the substance contains alcohol or the device detects alcohol.
Rule24: A routine check occurs or a special case occurs.
Rule25: Provided that a special case occurs, standard procedure is followed or an emergency test occurs.
Rule26: If logs are complete, then proper documentation exists.
Rule27: Logs are complete or records are available.
Rule28: Under the condition that records are available, provided that a routine check occurs, the protocol is followed.
Rule29: A sample is collected or evidence is secured.
Rule30: If the device detects alcohol, then it is not the case that the game competition is active.
Rule31: Provided that evidence is secured, the substance contains alcohol or the device detects alcohol.
Rule32: Under the condition that the chain of custody is maintained, if a sample is collected, then the substance contains alcohol or the device detects alcohol.
Rule33: Contamination is suspected or the chain of custody is maintained.
Rule34: Provided that strong evidence exists, if the appeal is granted, then an appeal is filed or if a test is required, then the substance contains alcohol or the device detects alcohol.
Rule35: Strong evidence exists or the case is weak.
Rule36: Provided that there is insufficient proof, whenever the appeal is granted, an appeal is filed or if a test is required, then the substance contains alcohol or the device detects alcohol.
Rule37: If the device gives conflicting results, then the device gives an accurate measurement.
Rule38: Whenever the device gives conflicting results, it is not the case that the device gives a reliable reading.
Rule39: The device gives conflicting results or if the case is weak, then there is insufficient proof.
Rule40: Provided that the device gives an accurate measurement, the device gives a reliable reading.
Rule41: Whenever the device uses direct detection, the device confirms the presence of alcohol.
Rule42: The device uses direct detection or the device uses indirect evidence.
Rule43: Provided that the device uses indirect evidence, the device detects alcohol.
Rule44: The device uses a primary sensor or the device uses a backup sensor.
Rule45: Provided that the device uses a backup sensor, whenever the device confirms the presence of alcohol, the substance contains alcohol.

Rule46: If the device's calibration is current, then under the condition that the device uses a primary sensor, provided that the device confirms the presence of alcohol, the substance contains alcohol.
Rule47: The device is within tolerance or the device is in an acceptable range.
Rule48: Provided that the device is in an acceptable range, the device does not need calibration.
Rule49: Under the condition that the device has an intermittent issue, it is not the case that the device operates stably.
Rule50: The device has a minor glitch or if it is not the case that whenever the device has an intermittent issue, the device operates stably, then the device has a persistent problem.
Rule51: If a temporary fix is applied, then a permanent solution is applied.
Rule52: A temporary fix is applied or if the device has a major malfunction, then the device does not have a minor glitch.
Rule53: A workaround is available or provided that a temporary fix is applied, a permanent solution does not occur.
Rule54: A review is scheduled or an appeal is filed or if a test is required, then the substance contains alcohol or the device detects alcohol.
Rule55: If the device has a serious issue, then the device has a critical problem.
Rule56: Under the condition that the device has a critical problem, the device has a severe malfunction.
Rule57: Whenever the device's issue is resolved, the device does not have continuing problems.
Rule58: The device's issue is resolved or the device is partially fixed.
Rule59: Provided that the device is partially fixed, the device is functional.
Rule60: If the device is functional, then the device does not have continuing problems.
Rule61: Provided that the player fails the test, the game competition is fair.
Rule62: The player fails the test or the player's violation is confirmed.

Rule63: Provided that it is not the case that human error occurs or if the game experiences a technical glitch, then the device produces a false positive, it is not the case that an investigation is warranted.
Rule64: Under the condition that it is not the case that the device experiences a sensor malfunction or the device experiences a software bug, the device has an intermittent issue.
Rule65: If it is not the case that the device experiences a hardware issue or the device experiences a firmware problem, then the device has a temporary issue.
Rule66: Provided that it is not the case that the device experiences a hardware issue or the device experiences a firmware problem, it is not the case that the device has a temporary issue.
Rule67: Whenever it is not the case that if the device is within tolerance, then the device does not need calibration, the device needs recalibration.

Rule68: Provided that it is not the case that whenever the device has a severe malfunction, equipment failure occurs or human error occurs or if the game experiences a technical glitch, then the device produces a false positive, it is not the case that the device requires replacement.

Rule69: If it is not the case that provided that it is not the case that human error occurs or if the game experiences a technical glitch, then the device produces a false positive, an investigation is warranted, then immediate action is taken.

Rule70: Under the condition that it is not the case that if it is not the case that whenever the device has a severe malfunction, equipment failure occurs or human error occurs or if the game experiences a technical glitch, then the device produces a false positive, the device requires replacement, the device has continuing problems.
Rule71: If the device's calibration is not current, then the device needs calibration.
Rule72: Provided that the game competition is not fair, the player is disqualified.
facts: Fact3: The device has a major malfunction.
Fact4: The device has a serious issue.
Fact5: It is not the case that the device produces a false positive.
Fact6: It is not the case that human error occurs.
Fact7: It is not the case that equipment failure occurs.
Fact8: It is not the case that the protocol is followed.
Fact9: It is not the case that proper documentation exists.
Fact10: It is not the case that contamination is suspected.
Fact11: It is not the case that the device needs recalibration.
Fact12: It is not the case that an appeal is filed.
Fact13: It is not the case that the device has a persistent problem.
Fact14: It is not the case that a workaround is available.
Fact15: It is not the case that immediate action is taken.
Fact16: It is not the case that a review is scheduled.
